question:
[Judy] and her son, [Freddie], went to the park to fly a kite. They had fun doing it all day. [Freddie]'s aunt, [Ethel], took him to the zoo. [Ethel] had to work a double shift and needed someone to watch her son [Henry]. Luckily his sister [Leila] was free. [Martin] and his sister, [Leila] love it when their grandmother visits because she spoils them. She is coming this week to watch them while their parents are out of town. [Dana] asked her daughter, [Judy], if she would like to go to a movie with her on Saturday night. [Larry] played scrabble with his mother [Dana] and his brother [Kenneth]. [Martin] likes to watch baseball with his brother. His name is [Gordon].
Question: How is [Gordon] related to [Kenneth]?

teacher_log.content:
You are a knowledgeable and patient professor whose role is to guide students in solving problems correctly.
Here is a question:
[Judy] and her son, [Freddie], went to the park to fly a kite. They had fun doing it all day. [Freddie]'s aunt, [Ethel], took him to the zoo. [Ethel] had to work a double shift and needed someone to watch her son [Henry]. Luckily his sister [Leila] was free. [Martin] and his sister, [Leila] love it when their grandmother visits because she spoils them. She is coming this week to watch them while their parents are out of town. [Dana] asked her daughter, [Judy], if she would like to go to a movie with her on Saturday night. [Larry] played scrabble with his mother [Dana] and his brother [Kenneth]. [Martin] likes to watch baseball with his brother. His name is [Gordon].
Question: How is [Gordon] related to [Kenneth]?
Task:
The question contains a large set of semi-synthetic stories involving hypothetical families. 
The task is to infer the relationship between two family members, whose relationship is not explicitly mentioned in the given story.
please provide a detailed analysis.
Note: Since your responsibility is to guide students in answering the question, your analysis should think step by step, 
Please note that your role is to guide them step by step through the problem, so please don't give them the final result

Step 1: Identify the family members mentioned in the story
- [Judy] (mother of [Freddie], daughter of [Dana], sister of [Leila], and aunt of [Henry])
- [Freddie] (son of [Judy])
- [Ethel] (aunt of [Freddie] and [Henry])
- [Henry] (son of [Ethel])
- [Leila] (sister of [Judy], aunt of [Henry] and [Freddie], and mother of [Martin] and [Gordon])
- [Martin] (son of [Leila], brother of [Gordon], and grandson of their grandmother)
- [Gordon] (son of [Leila] and brother of [Martin])
- [Dana] (mother of [Judy] and [Kenneth], and grandmother of [Martin] and [Gordon])
- [Kenneth] (son of [Dana] and brother of [Judy])

Step 2: Determine the relationship between [Gordon] and [Kenneth]
- [Gordon] is the son of [Leila]
- [Kenneth] is the son of [Dana]
- [Leila] and [Dana] are sisters
- Therefore, [Gordon] and [Kenneth] are cousins

Step 3: Explain the relationship between [Gordon] and [Kenneth]
- [Gordon] and [Kenneth] are cousins because their mothers, [Leila] and [Dana], are sisters. This makes them first cousins, as they are the children of siblings.
